title: Subset with all Digits
text:
Given a list of n d-digit numbers, choose the smallest subset from the list that covers all the digits [0 - 9].InputFirst line contains a positive integer T representing number of test cases.Next line contains two numbers n and d, where n is the size of the list and d is number of digits in each number.Next n lines follow each containing a d digit number made from [0 - 9].1 ≤ t ≤ 1001 ≤ n ≤ 10001 ≤ d ≤ 1000OutputOutput the length of the smallest subset that covers all digits [0 - 9]. Return -1 if not possible.ExampleInput:2
4 5
01234
56789
01456
13452
4 5
11234
56789
01456
13452Output:2
3ExplanationSmallest set will be {01234, 56789}Smallest set will be {11234, 56789, 01456}
